intro: Streptocarpus volkensii, commonly known as the African violet, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is native to East Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 15–30 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white, which are often borne in clusters. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Streptocarpus volkensii is popular as a houseplant due to its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
